title: 2020: When sport had to pause, but unleashed its power
description: BBC sports editor Dan Roan looks back on a dramatic sporting year which was impacted by Covid-19.

title: Who 'could be anything he wants to be'? Garth Crooks' team of the week
description: Whose name should be the first on the England team sheet and who "pulled a rabbit out of the hat"? Find out in Garth Crooks' team of the week.

title: Defending champion Wright knocked out by 31st seed Clemens
description: Peter Wright's reign as world champion is over after he was sensationally upset by German 31st seed Gabriel Clemens at Alexandra Palace.

title: From 'completely ridiculous' first half to respect from Klopp - the Allardyce effect
description: How Sam Allardyce proved the doubters wrong when he masterminded a draw for West Brom at Liverpool in the Premier League.

title: Pi the whale is Christmas treat for Scilly islanders
description: A humpback whale swimming just a few hundred metres offshore delights people on the Isles of Scilly.

title: Glastonbury to gallery: 60ft Dolls drummer Carl Bevan turns to art
description: The crowd-surfing hedonistic punk has gone from Britpop party animal to promising painter.

title: Covid: EU launches mass vaccination in 'touching moment of unity'
description: Some member states jump the gun before Sunday's co-ordinated rollout of a coronavirus jab.

title: Christmas Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles jumper a Twitter hit
description: Hannah George's mum creates a replica of a jumper knitted by her daughter's gran 30 years ago.

title: Andy Murray awarded wildcard for February's delayed Australian Open
description: Andy Murray gets a wildcard for February's Australian Open, two years after what looked like his final appearance.

title: Newcastle 'mass hysteria' is 'unjust & unfair', says Bruce
description: Newcastle United manager Steve Bruce says some of the "mass hysteria" around his side after a "bad week" is "unjust and unfair".

title: Storm Bella: Gusts of more than 100mph recorded in UK
description: Weather warnings are in place in England and Wales, as well as two "threat to life" flood notices.

title: Rahane's fine century puts India in control against Australia
description: Stand-in captain Ajinkya Rahane's brilliant unbeaten century gives India control of the second Test against Australia on day two.

title: Will EU health insurance cards still be valid?
description: Will you be able to use the European Health Insurance Card from the start of 2021?

title: Covid: Cardiff health board plea for critical care help
description: The health board running Wales' largest hospital says it is "extremely busy" due to Covid-19.

title: Dog invades football pitch in Bolivia
description: A dog paused a football game for three minutes, as it ran around with a football boot in its mouth.

title: Teen critically injured in Stockport police vehicle crash
description: Officers say they were heading to a report of a domestic disturbance when the boy, 15, was struck.

title: Brady inspires Buccaneers into NFL play-offs
description: Tom Brady helps the Tampa Bay Buccaneers secure an NFL first play-off spot since 2007 in a win over the Detroit Lions.

title: Drakeford: Wales has less influence on Johnson
description: Relations between the four UK nations were closer under Theresa May, Wales' first minister says.

title: UK's oldest postmistress Kay White retires after 80 years
description: Kay White started working at Claverley Post Office in Shropshire at the age of 14.

title: Brexit: PM vows to focus on 'levelling up country' after securing deal
description: Boris Johnson promises "big changes" after Brexit, but fishermen's leaders accuse him of "caving in".

title: Covid-19: Variant spreads, as EU states begin vaccinations
description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Sunday morning.

title: Losing a daughter to cancer during the Covid-19 pandemic
description: Áine Kearns remembers her "caring, incredibly witty" daughter Anna, 18, who died in August.

title: Irish state papers: IRA 'wanted to exclude Sinn Féin from talks'
description: Irish government papers from 1990 suggest some IRA bosses did not share the party's socialist views.

title: The Papers: Oxford jab 'set for approval' as vulnerable identified
description: Most of Sunday's papers report that the Oxford Covid vaccine could be approved within days.

title: Covid: Trump fails to sign economic relief bill into law
description: Millions of Americans temporarily lose unemployment benefits after the deadline for signing passes.

title: Margaret Thatcher: Ex-PM described euro as a 'rush of blood to the head'
description: Evidence of the former UK prime minister's Euroscepticism is revealed in newly released archives.

title: Nashville explosion 'probably suicide bombing'
description: Investigators conduct DNA tests after human remains are found and a house is searched.

title: Art in 2021: The highlights to hope for
description: Some exhibitions and galleries scheduled to open, including Tutankhamun relics and a movie museum.

title: Why is India denying prisoners spectacles and straws?
description: Jail officials have been called out for being cruel to prisoners - especially the government's critics.

title: How Ugandan Nasa scientist Catherine Nakalembe uses satellites to boost farming
description: Catherine Nakalembe won this year's Africa Food Prize for pioneering work using satellite images.

title: How Covid-19 altered world events in 2020
description: The pandemic affected us all - and shaped global issues, with knock-on effects for millions.

title: Has Thomas Becket's treasured 'little book' been found?
description: Thomas Becket, killed in Canterbury in 1170, was attached to a "little book", which may now have been found in Cambridge.

title: Ikram Abdi Omar: the hijabi model breaking boundaries
description: Ikram Abdi Omar was the UK's first hijab-wearing model to feature on the cover of Vogue.

title: Hemel Hempstead brothers swap 'revolting' football shirts for Christmas
description: The tradition began as the brothers wanted to make Christmas more exciting than exchanging vouchers.

title: Coronavirus: What has Covid done for climate crisis?
description: Lockdowns around the world have led to record falls in CO2 emissions. But will this lead to long lasting change?

title: Make-up artist: 'I was sneaking into Mum's make-up bag, aged 5'
description: A 13-year-old girl has built up a following of thousands on social media.

title: Covid in the classroom: How the pandemic changed these three teachers' lives
description: Three teachers in the US reflect on how drastically their jobs have changed during 2020.

title: 2020 and me: 'EndSARS was our Black Lives Matter'
description: After protests, a strike, and lockdown, Kiki, a student from Lagos, Nigeria, can’t wait for the year to be over.
